entry.string: Authinvision2 Authentication Module
Overview
What is it?

The Authinvision2 module provides authentication based on Invision Power Board's v2.x user base. The intended purpose is to utilize IPB's proprietary Converge technology, but currently uses SQL queries to authenticate the user with the existing Converge implementation. The Xaraya Event API is used for user login and logout events which performs the actual login process to IPB. The authinvision2 module also assumes the database server is mysql.
How to use it?
From the menu, you have seven choices.
Server - The hostname running the database (defaults to localhost).
Database - The name of the database for IPB.
Username - The username used to connect to the IPB database.
Password - The password used to connect to the IPB database.
Invision table prefix - The prefix used for the IPB tables (do not include a "_").
Invision forum Root - This is the relative path to your IPB installation.
Use Authinvision2 exclusively - Setting this will set authinvision2 to be your only authentication mechanism, and can not be unset.
Default Xaraya Group - The default group to add new users into.
Included Blocks
login - A modified Roles login block that adds the ability for a user to set themselves as invisible. This only affects the IPB login, and has no affect in Xaraya.
Included Hooks
The Authinvision2 Module has no hooks included at this time.

Included with the authinvision2 module is a class that can be used on IPB's side to log a user into Xaraya in order to provide two-way login capability. In the modules/authinvision2 directory, copy the XarayaIPB-1.0.3.tar.gz file into your forumroot directory and unpack it, which will create a new directory called modules/xaraya. Included in this directory is a README.txt file containing instructions on modifying IPB, and an example ipb_member_sync.php file.
